data.text: How Long Does a Canister of Gas Last If Cooking Simple Meals?

This is a bit of a silly question, but how long on average would a small canister(c300) of gas last if cooking simple meals and 1 or 2 brews? I assume for a few days, if cooking for maybe 30 mins total each day?(say 10 mins for porridge in the morning and a brew, then a reasonable tea at night and another brew/coffee).
Go and have a play on YouTube.it all depends on the stove how muck gas it uses to boil two cups of water it’s about 9g depending on how cold the water or wind
data.author: Gary Howarth

data.text: Yea mate, not after anything too scientific, just a rough idea. worst case, i could weight it before i go, then when i get back home, as that should give me a rough / ball park idea
data.author: Ray Breen

data.text: I make brews at work on mine, used it 15 times at least with a mini etna stove and a mess tin with a lid, enough water to make a brew and cup noodles. Still plenty of gas left.
data.author: Nick Luton

data.text: I have a pocket rocket mk 2 excellent little stove boils very quickly.
data.author: Douglas Woodhouse

data.text: We boiled water for 2 of us for 6 mornings and 6 nights on 2x 100g canisters, porridge/coffee in the mornings, dehydrated/boil in bag meals and hot chocolate in the evenings.
data.author: Morgan Jones

data.text: ah cool, so i should get potentially a couple of weeks out of a single c300 sized cannister, thats great

data.text: hopefully, all stoves are different, and we we're pretty efficient with our usage to achieve that.

data.text: One idea is run a quick test at home (preferably outdoors to include wind / temperature). Weigh the canister before, cook something, weigh it after and do the maths from there

data.text: Yea, thats my plan(although not at home), i will weight it when i get back, and do some basic division, will give me a ball park idea on how many average nights i can get away with

data.text: With our jetboil a c100 will last 1 week making a couple of brew and heating water for noodles. Our other stove last about 10 days cooking our main meal using a c300. Make sure you buy 3 minute pasta and 10 min rice that saves gas too.
